definition: Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Liang Dynasty (502-557)/Later Liang Dynasty (907-923)/surname Liang
variant of 梁[liang2]
roof beam/beam (structure)/bridge
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
variant of 啟|启[qi3]
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-

sentences.english: The value orientation and objective effect of Liang Qichao's thought in popularization.
sentences.chinese: 梁启超大众化文学思想的价值取向与客观效果。

sentences.english: Finally, Liang Qichao also advocated to modernizing the principles and methods of our education.
sentences.chinese: 最后，梁启超还大力倡导教育原则与方法的现代化。

sentences.english: Liang Qichao's literary achievement in biographies of contemporary personages was all but ignored.
sentences.chinese: 梁启超在当代人物传记方面的创作成就很少有人注意。

sentences.english: Liang Qichao is a distinguished thinker of the capitalist class in modern Chinese history .
sentences.chinese: 梁启超是我国近代杰出的资产阶级启蒙思想家。

sentences.english: Liang Qichao was a famous activist and statesman in mod ern China.
sentences.chinese: 梁启超近代中国著名的报刊活动家和政论家。

sentences.english: The study on Liang Qichao has long been the focus of the academic world.
sentences.chinese: 梁启超研究是学术界长期以来的重点和热点。

sentences.english: Liang, once a student of Kang's, helped Kang by writing articles propagating reformist ideas.
sentences.chinese: 康有为的学生梁启超协助撰写文章，宣传变法思想。

sentences.english: Sheng Xuanhuai I am also quite enjoy Liang.
sentences.chinese: 盛宣怀本人对梁启超也颇为欣赏。

sentences.english: Proceeding in an orderly way is the basic mentality of Liang Qichao's currency system reformation.
sentences.chinese: 循序渐进是梁启超币制改革的基本思路。

sentences.english: Liang Qichao's aesthetic thoughts are of taste-oriented life aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 梁启超的美学思想是崇尚趣味主义的人生美学。

sentences.english: Part one probes in the basic targets of Liang Qichao s diplomatic thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分探讨了梁启超外交思想的根本目标。

sentences.english: Kang Youwei and Liang Qichao narrowly escaped.
sentences.chinese: 康有为和梁启超侥幸逃脱。

definition: Kang Youwei (1858-1927), Confucian intellectual, educator and would-be reformer, main leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
Ku Hung-ming or Gu Hongming (1857-1928), Malaysian man of letters, highly regarded for his literary works written mostly in English, and known for his monarchist views
Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
Tan Sitong (1865-1898), Qing writer and politician, one of the Six Gentlemen Martyrs 戊戌六君子 of the unsuccessful reform movement of 1898
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Wang Guowei (1877-1927), noted scholar
the reformist faction
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Zhang Taiyan 章太炎 (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
